title: The Birth of Korean Cool (2014) epub
description:
The Birth of Korean Cool: How One Nation Is Conquering the World Through Pop Culture

A FRESH, FUNNY, UP-CLOSE LOOK AT HOW SOUTH KOREA REMADE ITSELF AS THE WORLDÃ¢â‚¬â„¢S POP CULTURE POWERHOUSE OF THE TWENTY-FIRST CENTURY

Ã¢â‚¬Å“Gangnam StyleÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ is only one tool in South KoreaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s extraordinarily elaborate and effective strategy to become a major world superpower by first becoming the worldÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s number one pop culture exporter.

 As a child, Euny Hong moved from America to the Gangnam neighbourhood in Seoul. She was a witness to the most accelerated part of South KoreaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s economic development, during which time it leapfrogged from third-world military dictatorship to first-world liberal democracy on the cutting edge of global technology.

 Euny Hong recounts how South Korea vaulted itself into the twenty-first century, becoming a global leader in business, technology, education, and pop culture. Featuring lively, in-depth reporting and numerous interviews with Koreans working in all areas of government and society, The Birth of Korean Cool reveals how a really uncool country became cool, and how a nation that once banned miniskirts, long hair on men, and rock Ã¢â‚¬ËœnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ roll could come to mass produce boy bands, soap operas, and the worldÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s most important smart phone
